New Records: Virat Kohli scored the fastest fifty in a T20 World Cup final
Heinrich Klaasen completed his fifty off 23 balls, the fastest ever in a T20 World Cup final
Key Match Events: Jasprit Bumrah took two wickets in the first over
Klaasen hit a six-filled charge, including three sixes
Suryakumar Yadav made a boundary catch
Hardik Pandya bowled two crucial wickets in the final over
Arshdeep Singh delivered a nerveless 19th over
Heinrich Klaasen and David Miller were out for four runs in the final over
Post-Match Reflections: Virat Kohli and his teammates celebrated their victory, saying they fulfilled what the whole nation wanted
Players expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win
Miscellaneous Highlights: India scored 176 for 7, the most by any team in a World Cup final
South Africa needed 30 off 30 balls with six wickets in hand, but failed to achieve it
Others: The match took place in Bridgetown, Barbados
The game was part of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2024
